No matter how much you hate a job, when it comes to working with kids, last days are so heart breaking.
It wasn't the kids I didn't like, obviously. The corporate run child care is the reason I hated it.
But oh my God! The kids... These beautiful little humans... They're incredible. They're unique, and smart, and stubborn, but mostly adorable. They are pure love.
You can feel it when they cry because they can't sit on your lap, or when you hug their little bodies and kiss their little faces. Just pure love!
So innocent. So amazing.
I am glad I got to know every child and every family I worked with. You become a part of their families as well. It's quite the experience.
Especially this age! I am some of these kids first teacher, first adult (other than their parents) they relied on to care for them, to comfort them.
It's sad to leave. I will miss them. They will be fine but I will always remember them.
Sure they made me sooo mad at times, but overall they made me laugh on a daily basis.
I may be being a bit dramatic here, but I do love them and I will miss them.
I will be much happier at my new job, but this experience has definitely changed my life.
I feel confident in my child care skills, and it reinforced what I already knew, that I will be a great parent some day. I learned some "what-to-do's" and definitely some "what-not-to-do's".
Goodbye Children of America, yet another chapter in this life closed.
